title: Equity capital markets' fourth-quarter dollar volume drops by more than two-thirds from peak levels; Equity capital markets soured considerably in 2022 as bull market conditions ended
text:
So far in full-year 2022, equity capital markets have raised $582 billion, well below the $733 billion raised in just the first half of 2021.

The U.S. total for equity capital market issuance is $167.5 billion in 2022, down from $779 billion in 2021 and the lowest total in at least a decade, according to Dealogic.

With $1.8 billion in the deal, Americana Restaurants International Plc AE:AMR was the largest new listing globally in the fourth quarter, followed by the U.S. listing Mobileye Global Inc. MBLY, the Israeli autonomous-vehicle unit of Intel Corp. INTC, and by the $897 million IPO of Marafiq in Saudi Arabia.

Korea's LG Energy Solution KR:373220 ranked as the largest IPO of the year globally, followed by Porsche AG XE:P911 and the Dubai Electricity and Water Authority AE:DEWA.

Meanwhile, mergers and acquisitions totaled $3.6 trillion in 2022, down 38.8% from 2021's record of $5.9 trillion.

Equity capital markets' fourth-quarter dollar volume drops by more than two-thirds from peak levels
